author: PetSerAl
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------
```powershell
& (New-Module { })
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
Descriptive error message.

Actual behavior
---------------
Generic `IndexOutOfRangeException` thrown.

Environment data
----------------
```powershell
> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha
CLRVersion
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.17-42-g5ff479ce0b2a46b4983fd381eec9c5fa1281946a
PSEdition                      Core
```

Info
----------------
Invocation operators `&` and `.` allows first argument to be `PSModuleInfo` object. In that case them invoke following command in scope of that module. But them fail to verify if the command actually provided or not, thus fail with `IndexOutOfRangeException` on [this line](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master@%7B2017-03-26%7D/src/System.Management.Automation/engine/runtime/Operations/MiscOps.cs#L61).
title: Invocation operator should provide descriptive error message, when no command supplied
